trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the Ancient Oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the Ancient Oblex corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Non magical ammunition made of metal that hits the Ancient Oblex is destroyed after dealing damage.
The Ancient Oblex can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Killer Response
entries: Any creature that starts its turn in White Maw's space is targeted by a pseudopod attack if White Maw isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries: The Ancient Oblex's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, 9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
3/day each: {@i charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts}
1/day each: {@i  dominate person, telekinesis}

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Ancient Oblex doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ancient Oblex makes three Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Eat Memories {@recharge 6}
entries: The oblex targets all creatures creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.

While memory drained, the target must roll a +0 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a +0, the d6 becomes a +0, and so on until the die becomes a +0, at which point the target becomes {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour. The effect then ends.
The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can take up 10 ft along any wall. The Gray Wall's space includes the wall and 5 ft. in front of it. Creatures can occupy the Gray Wall's space

trait.name: In Plain Sight
entries: The Gray Wall is hidden until it reveals itself by attacking or if a creature succeeds a {@dc 14} investigation check after the Gray Wall {@b {@i Propogates Spawn}}. Until then it has advantage on all Constitution, Dexterity, and Strength saving throws.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

action.name: Propagate Ooze
entries: The Gray Wall releases 1 ({@damage 1d2}) {@b {@i psychic grey oozes}} that immediately move.
